raw_comment:
I noticed that the majority of players in all sports, except for major league baseball, are players of color. Basketball in particular is dominated by people of color with an approximate 4:1 ratio for both genders, while baseball is almost equal but leaning towards white people with a 3:2 ratio. 
In every poll, it is clear that the percentage of head coaches of color are significantly lower than the percentage of players of color. In National League Football, most of the players are of color (74%), whilst head coaches of color are only 13%. I wonder why is there such a noticeable difference between players of color and coaches of color? In the sports Major League Baseball and Major League Soccer, the percentage of head coaches of color are 20% lower than players of color. This is a smaller difference compared to the 60% difference in National League Football. As for Women's and Men's National Basketball Association, the percentage difference between coaches of color and players of color is around 50%. 
Although some differences are more noticeable than others, we can clearly see that people of color are less likely to be head coach in a major sports league. This has an impact on the community around us because it shows people of color have different opportunities to be in power than white people.
An interesting headline would be, "Player of Colors vs. Head Coaches of Color in different major sports leagues".
